message_1: In a group of 50 students, 20 take English, 30 take French and 15 take both English and French. How many students take either English or French (but not both)?
message_2:
To find the number of students who take either English or French (but not both), we can use the principle of inclusion-exclusion. 

Total students taking English or French = Students taking English + Students taking French - Students taking both English and French

Total students = 20 (English) + 30 (French) - 15 (Both)

Total students = 50 - 15 = 35

So, 35 students take either English or French (but not both).
